intro: Setachna microptilon, commonly known as the small-winged setachna, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are compound, with finely divided leaflets that give it a delicate appearance. Setachna microptilon is relatively rare and is often found in specific microhabitats within its native range.
